title: Ticket #4971: Correctly track resource usage across vanilla universe checkpoints
description: We don't currently do anything to preserve the usage numbers over a checkpoint, which means our reported usage numbers are probably hilariously wrong.
remarks:
2016-Feb-16 14:47:32 by tlmiller:
See the third FIXME in https://htcondor-wiki.cs.wisc.edu/index.cgi/chngview?cn=44488, part of #4972.

2020-Jul-31 11:30:11 by tlmiller:
LIGO confirms and is now actually concerned about this. (See #7762.)

2020-Aug-05 04:24:57 by tlmiller:
Should the shadow changes be cherry-picked into stable?

They fix a clear stable-series bug.

However, the patch doesn't apply for some reason, which presages an ugly merge conflict. More importantly, perhaps, the bug is old enough that I don't think anyone actually cares, which tempts me to save some effort. It's an important fix for self-checkpointing jobs, where the cumulative usage is more likely to be a meaningful number. For other jobs, it seems less relevant.

2020-Aug-05 04:25:25 by tlmiller:
Assigned to TimT to elicit an answer to the above.

2020-Aug-05 09:20:53 by tlmiller:
TIL: the magic option to 'git cherry-pick' is '-X ignore-space-changes'. TimT will make the cherry-pick happen after some other (stable-to-master) merge conflicts are resolved.

2020-Aug-05 18:53:51 by tlmiller:
As a stable-series fix, somebody (else) needs to formally record their code review, but I think we're otherwise done here, now that I redid the release notes.

2020-Aug-05 19:06:49 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: LGTM
